Chapter.Section: Overview and Introduction This is the manual for the Viz package version 0.1.x

Installing Viz
In this section we give a brief description of how to start using Viz. If you have any problems getting Viz working, then you could try emailling me at jdm3@st-and.ac.uk.
It is assumed that you have a working copy of &GAP; with version number 4.5 or higher. The most up-to-date version of &GAP; and instructions on how to install it can be obtained from the main &GAP; webpage \vspace{\baselineskip}
\noindent\vspace{\baselineskip} http://www.gap-system.org
\noindent The following is a summary of the steps that should lead to a successful installation of Viz:
download and install the Orb package version 3.7 or higher. For more details go to: \vspace{\baselineskip}
\noindent\vspace{\baselineskip}http://www-groups.mcs.st-and.ac.uk/~neunhoef/Computer/Software/Gap/orb.html
\noindent Note that both Orb and Viz are faster if Orb is compiled.
download the package archive viz0r1.tar.gz from \vspace{\baselineskip}
\noindent\vspace{\baselineskip}http://www-history.mcs.st-and.ac.uk/~jamesm/viz/index.html
unzip and untar the file, this should create a directory called viz.
locate the pkg directory of your &GAP; directory, which contains several other directories such as lib, doc and so on. Move the directory viz into the pkg directory.
start &GAP; in the usual way.
type LoadPackage("viz");
compile the documentation by typing VizMakeDoc()
Below is an example of an installation of Viz in a UNIX environment where GAPROOT should be substituted with the main &GAP; directory (the one containing the folders bin, lib, and so on) in your installation of &GAP;.
> gunzip viz-0.1.x.tar.gz > tar -xf viz0.1.x.tar > mv viz GAPROOT/pkg > gap
[ ... ]
gap> LoadPackage("viz"); ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Loading orb 3.7 (orb - Methods to enumerate orbits) by Juergen Mueller (http://www.math.rwth-aachen.de/~Juergen.Mueller), Max Neunhoeffer (http://www-groups.mcs.st-and.ac.uk/~neunhoef), and Felix Noeske (http://www.math.rwth-aachen.de/~Felix.Noeske). ---------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Loading Viz 0.1 (Viz - ) by J. D. Mitchell (http://tinyurl.com/jdmitchell). ---------------------------------------------------------------------- true gap>
Presuming that the above steps can be completed successfully you will be running the Viz package!

Compiling the documentation
To compile the documentation see . If you want to use the help system it is essential that you compile the documentation.
